title: Ticket #624: DC_DAEMON_LIST += notiation not recognized by condor_config_val
description:
$ cat > test.cfg << EOF
DC_DAEMON_LIST = A, B, C
DC_DAEMON_LIST += D
EOF
$ env CONDOR_CONFIG=test.cfg condor_config_val DC_DAEMON_LIST
D

It should return A, B, C, D.
remarks:
2009-Jul-15 11:42:32 by nleroy:
You're using the incorrect syntax... The correct syntax is: DC_DAEMON_LIST = + <list> Note: = + not +=

So, condor_config_val does handle this correctly. I'm marking this as resolved.

2009-Jul-15 12:01:34 by matt:
Ok, but did you check to see that it works with the proper notation? 

# cat test.cfg
DC_DAEMON_LIST = A, B, C
DC_DAEMON_LIST += D
# env CONDOR_CONFIG=test.cfg condor_config_val DC_DAEMON_LIST
D

# cat test.cfg
DC_DAEMON_LIST = A, B, C
DC_DAEMON_LIST =+ D
# env CONDOR_CONFIG=test.cfg condor_config_val DC_DAEMON_LIST
+ D

# cat test.cfg
DC_DAEMON_LIST = A, B, C
DC_DAEMON_LIST = + D
# env CONDOR_CONFIG=test.cfg condor_config_val DC_DAEMON_LIST
+ D

# condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.3.2 Jul 13 2009 BuildID: RH-7.3.2-0.3.el5 PRE-RELEASE-UWCS $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-LINUX_RHEL5 $

2009-Jul-15 12:10:10 by nleroy:
Read the manual entry again... "a daemon may be appended to the default DC_DAEMON_LIST value", where "default" is the operative value. This syntax causes the effective value to be the default with the specified list appended to it. There's no way for condor_config_val to know what that default list is.

2009-Jul-15 15:47:27 by matt:
That's terribly confusing semantics then. Do they imply... 

DC_DAEMON_LIST =+ A
DC_DAEMON_LIST =+ B

...results in a DC_DAEMON_LIST of DEFAULT(DC_DAEMON_LIST), B?

2009-Jul-15 15:54:14 by nleroy:
Yes

2009-Jul-15 16:13:53 by matt:
Eek, ok. Guess this can be closed or turned into an RFE where .=+ works more like one might expect +.=. In any event a clarifying statement might go into the manual about repeated uses of .=+.
creator: matt
